required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AMPED Outcomes Registry of Post-ED Pain Management
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Management of Pain From the Emergency Department: A National, Emergency Department-Based Prospective Post-Intervention Registry of Non-Opioid and Opioid Management of Acute Pain

brief_summary.textblock: Study aims to assess patient-recorded outcomes of pain control medications prescribed in the ER after visits for specific painful injuries/illnesses.

detailed_description.textblock: Multicenter, observational, prospective, out-of-hospital registry collecting clinical, satisfaction, quality of life, and healthcare resource utilization from subjects discharged after ED care for a specific acute pain syndrome with a clinician-determined analgesic regimen. Subjects are stratified by diagnosis and by regimen based on the treating clinician's judgment. The registry study is independent of ED care and clinician's decision-making.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Outcomes of pain control measures

arm_group.description: Subjects have their pain treated post-ED care with NSAID medication alone
Subjects have their pain treated post-ED care with opioid medication alone
Subjects have their pain treated post-ED care with NSAID medication and opioid as PRN rescue analgesia

study_pop.textblock: at least 800 patients with specific musculoskeletal or visceral pain syndrome

facility.name: University of Texas HSC at Houston
